etymology.description: 或(或) (huò, "or; maybe") suggests options or possibilities, while 者(者) (zhě, "one who; -er, -ist") forms a noun or emphasizes the role or function of the preceding element. Together, 或者(或者) (huòzhě, "or; perhaps") combines these concepts to denote an alternative or potential scenario.
etymology.interpretation: 或者(或者) (huòzhě, "or; perhaps") is used to present choices or possibilities in a sentence, reflecting uncertainty or alternative options.

examples.chinese: 你可以吃面包(你可以吃麵包)，或者米饭(或者米飯)。
examples.pinyin: nǐ kěyǐ chī miànbāo, huòzhě mǐfàn.
examples.english: You can eat bread or rice.

examples.chinese: 我们明天出发(我們明天出發)，或者今天先走(或者今天先走)。
examples.pinyin: wǒmen míngtiān chūfā, huòzhě jīntiān xiān zǒu.
examples.english: We will depart tomorrow or leave today.
